intro: Faroa amara, commonly known as the bitter faroa, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous seeds. Faroa amara is often found in moist, forested areas and is adapted to the humid climate of its native habitat.
